data.title: 20 Facts About David Hewlett
data.meta_description: Discover 20 fascinating facts about David Hewlett, from his early life to his successful acting career and personal achievements. Delve into the life of this talented celebrity!
data.text:
Source: Stargate-fusion.com

David Hewlett is a name that resonates with fans of science fiction, especially those who love "Stargate Atlantis." But who is this talented actor beyond his iconic role as Dr. Rodney McKay? David Hewlett is not just an actor; he's a director, writer, and tech enthusiast. Born in England and raised in Canada, his journey into the entertainment industry is as fascinating as his on-screen characters. Did you know he started his career in low-budget horror films? Or that he's a self-proclaimed computer geek? Whether you're a die-hard fan or just curious, these 20 facts about David Hewlett will give you a deeper look into his life, career, and passions. Buckle up for some surprising tidbits!

Early Life and Background

David Hewlett is a name many recognize from the world of science fiction. His journey to stardom is filled with interesting tidbits.

Born on April 18, 1968, in Redhill, Surrey, England, David Hewlett moved to Canada at a young age.

Hewlett attended St. George's College in Toronto, where he developed an interest in acting and computers.

Before acting, he was a self-taught computer programmer and even ran his own computer company, Darkyl Media.

Acting Career

David Hewlett's acting career spans several decades, with roles in both television and film.

Hewlett's first significant role was in the 1988 film "Pin," where he played the character Leon.

He gained widespread recognition for his role as Dr. Rodney McKay in the "Stargate" franchise, starting with "Stargate SG-1" and continuing in "Stargate Atlantis."

Hewlett has appeared in over 100 episodes of "Stargate Atlantis," making him a staple of the series.

He has also guest-starred in popular TV shows like "The Outer Limits," "ER," and "CSI: Crime Scene Investigation."

Directing and Writing

Not just an actor, David Hewlett has also ventured into directing and writing.

Hewlett wrote and directed the 2007 film "A Dog's Breakfast," a dark comedy that also starred his sister, Kate Hewlett.

He directed the sci-fi thriller "Debug" in 2014, which featured his "Stargate Atlantis" co-star Jason Momoa.

Hewlett has written several scripts, showcasing his versatility in the entertainment industry.

Personal Life

David Hewlett's personal life is as intriguing as his professional one.

Hewlett married actress Jane Loughman in 2008, and they have a son named Sebastian.

He is an avid dog lover and often shares pictures of his pets on social media.

Hewlett is a vocal advocate for science and technology, frequently participating in related events and discussions.

Interesting Tidbits

Here are some lesser-known facts about David Hewlett that fans might find fascinating.

Hewlett is a huge fan of the "Doctor Who" series and has expressed interest in appearing on the show.

He has a passion for 3D printing and often shares his creations online.

Hewlett is known for his witty and humorous social media presence, engaging with fans regularly.

He has a YouTube channel where he shares behind-the-scenes content, tech reviews, and personal vlogs.

Awards and Recognition

David Hewlett's contributions to the entertainment industry have not gone unnoticed.

He won the 2008 Leo Award for Best Lead Performance by a Male in a Dramatic Series for his role in "Stargate Atlantis."

Hewlett has been nominated for several other awards, including the Gemini Awards and the Saturn Awards.

His work in "A Dog's Breakfast" received critical acclaim, further establishing him as a talented filmmaker.

David Hewlett continues to be a beloved figure in the sci-fi community, with a career that shows no signs of slowing down.

Final Thoughts on David Hewlett

David Hewlett's career is a fascinating blend of acting, directing, and writing. From his early days in Canadian television to his iconic role as Dr. Rodney McKay in Stargate Atlantis, Hewlett has shown remarkable versatility. His work in independent films and his passion for technology and science fiction further highlight his diverse talents. Beyond the screen, Hewlett's engagement with fans on social media and his efforts in raising awareness for various causes make him a well-rounded individual. Whether you're a long-time fan or just discovering his work, there's no denying the impact he's had on the entertainment industry. Keep an eye on his future projects; Hewlett's journey is far from over.
